column5: Well I just got back from the 'Rock'.....spent 2 weeks there. Simply amazing....I forgot how beautiful this place was.  My sister got married so it was pretty hectic the first 5 days. After all the chaos of the wedding my fiancee and myself left for the Northern Peninsula of Newfoundland for some sight seeing.  The scenery is absolutely breath taking....the pictures don't do any justice.  Newfoundland scenery is so diverse depending on which part of the Rock you visit.  There are so many moose in Newfoundland that it's dangerous to be driving at night.    The first night away we stayed at a beautiful lodge at Big Falls (salmon river)  Unfortunately you need a guide to fish the salmon rivers in Newfoundland (very costly) so I didn't do any salmon fishing, but we saw several fish jumping at the falls....pretty cool.   The second night we stayed at a small B&B in Rocky Harbour and went to the hotel for some Newfoundland entertainment and music. Some more beautiful scenery along the way.      The next morning we went on a boat tour for 2 1/2 hours into an inland fjord. Definately the highlite of our trip.            I took 291 pictures of our trip.....so I don't want to bore you with so many, but here some pics from the rest of our trip.  These are from the Grand Lake area....my old stomping grounds.  I wanted to show my fiancee some of the back country that are not in the tourist guide books            I have so many pics.....but that's enough.  If you ever have the opportunity to visit the Rock....go for it...you won't be disappointed.  Jason
Basskicker those are not boring photos they are absolutely breathtaking pics thanks for posting these amazing pictures and the rock is on my list of places to visit.  MTP

Thanks for posting those!!  How far up the peninsula did you make it? I'm from the very northern tip. Your not kidding, it is absolutely beautiful country, and the people are second to none!!  Thanks again! Sinker
Outstanding pictures  Thanks so much for sharing them.  They are beautiful.  Joey
WOW evryone of those pics are POSTCARDS, simply amazing,scenery..  ..gods country for sure,thanks for sharing,i love seeing pics like that....cheers
beautiful country and pics,thanks for sharing

OMG... breath taking Pictures... Thank you, so much, for sharing them.....  I've always wanted to visit the Rock........ someday and I will. you've just given me a little more encouragement....  My brother-in-law say's he will be MY guide... I'm to pick him up on the way by...... lol  You both look like you were havin a great time.....

Wow...the pics were incredible...hard to imagine how much better it was up close and personal.  Looked like an awesome trip Jason...a real deserved break from work!  Glad to see you did get some fishing in (your BOQ report).  Talk to you soon....we gotta fish for more bass again soon...LOL.
Great post, makes me want  to go there even more.
I have always wanted to vist the rock.But after seeing those pictures I am going.Fantastic post and pictures.

Hey Basskicker.   I almost laughed at the first two pics.  I thought they were the same pic with the Moose lying in ambush under the warning sign.  You folks have some extremely beautiful country up there.  You ain't gonna bore us with more pics ... would love to see PART 2, PART 3, etc.
....Suddenly I have an urge to visit "The Rock". Must put it on my "to do" list. Great pictures.
Great pictures! Not boring at all!
that is the one place in Canada that I have not been but realy want to some day it looks awsome great pics
Definitely one of the nicest parts of the country. Great pictures Jason!
Canada sure has some scenic coastline! I think the newfies should consider eating some moose with their fish and chips.  Thanks for posting!
Thanks for posting and taking us for a tour. Thats one place I'd love to go. Did you fly, or take the ferry across? I've heard the ferry is an experience also. You wouldn't want to meet nicer people.
Nice pictures thar bai!!!
Da'sh some foine pictures dere, b'y.  Dat pond w' de missus on dat stone looks right some jaisus cam, b'y.
The place looks amazing, great pics! I am supposed to go next summer for a couple of weeks, can hardly wait!

Hey Sinker, I only made it up as far as Daniels Harbour.....planned on sneaking into one of the brookie ponds I once visited as a kid, but unfortunately I didn't have the time and the weather was simply horrible.  It rained every day for the last 8 days I was there.....there's a old saying 'If you don't like the weather, wait 10 minutes, It'll change'  Fish Farmer, actually I flew down (direct flight) into my home town Stephenville and rented a vehicle.  It's cheaper to fly then drive during the summer months.....but then you miss out on the ferry.  Quite an experience when the seas get rough.  And yes, the hospitality of Newfoundlander's is unbeatable!!!  Jason
